div1.p: Carter reports on his health and his travel plans.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, February 6, 1915
div1.opener:
HOTEL FLORENCE
1909
B
FLORENCE, S. C., Feb 6 1915
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
I can't tell you where to write
so far- I presume to Whitney N. C. but
will not be able to tell definitely un-
til tomorrow:

I have been quite well up to yesterday
& yesterday was very well indeed.
Although I had quite an active
day of it. I made a mistake
on choice of route last night, by
which I did not get to bed last night
until 1.45 this morning. It was a
piece of foolishness & I wish I had
had more sense. I didn't,

I am en rol route direct from Charles-
ton to Whitney & I judge it would have
been better to have gone via
Columbia & Spartanburg & got to
HOTEL FLORENCE
1909
B
FLORENCE, S. C.,____________________191__
Satis Salisbury tonight-9.30 if on
time- seen Mr Henderson Monday
morning & gave to Whitney during
that day. We will be there about 2.30
P. M. today - so we may save 24 hours
time. On the other hand I doubt if
we can do any thing there with out
Mr H. & may have to go to Salisbu-
ry any how- It is about 15 miles
distant, maybe 20. Also this is
a more fatiguing route.

Please tell little Laura that I think
I have lost my fountain pen.
It is possible, that I left it in the
clothes I wore down town - last Thurs-
day - if so it is in the left hand pock-
et of either the Coat. or Vest. I think
G-
HOTEL FLORENCE
1909
B
FLORENCE, S. C.,____________________191__
however that the clip pulled loose in
the sleeping car

Hope I will feel as well to day & to-
morrow as I did yesterday - which
was the best I have felt since New-
Years day.
Dear Love to you & to all the rest
